cleaned_text: Hormone Balancing Hormones are your body's chemical messengers that travel throughout the body, target a specific tissue and enter cells through "receptor" sites, similar to a key and a lock. Once inside the cell, they influence many processes including: Growth and Development Metabolism Sexual function Reproduction Mood You have probably heard about hormonal imbalances recently, as research is slowly revealing that hormone deficiencies and excesses can cause many chronic disorders. If you have tried treatments but they don't seem to work, testing your hormones may be the first step to feeling better. We work commonly with endocrine (hormone) disorders including: Thyroid disease (hypothyroid, Hashimoto's Thyroiditis, Grave's disease) Adrenal Fatigue Estrogen Dominance Progesterone Deficiency Other Sex Hormone Imbalances The endocrine system is a complex system with many different influences.
